short_description: This function generates predictions on a response variable for a dataset.
long_description: This function uses a decision forest model from the TD_DecisionForest function to create predictions on a response variable for a test dataset.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input test data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input test data.

input_tables.name: ModelTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the model data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the model data.

argument_clauses.name: IDColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set.

argument_clauses.name: Detailed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output detailed information about the forest trees; that is, the decision tree and the specific tree information, including task index and tree index for each tree. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to output detailed information about the forest trees; that is, the decision tree and the specific tree information, including task index and tree index for each tree. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: OutputProb
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output probabilities. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to output probabilities. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: Responses
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies responses for which to output probabilitites.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies responses for which to output probabilitites.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
